parent_formation: No. 258 Wing, Western Desert Air Force

commander.name: Unknown (not identified in available Tier 1/2 sources for Q4 1941)

sources: historyofwar.org - No. 45 Squadron (RAF) during the Second World War (Tier 2)
RAF Web - Orders of Battle December 1941 (Tier 2, official RAF)
The Crusader Project - Blenheim Operations in Operation Crusader (Tier 2)
metadata.notes: Unit operated Bristol Blenheim Mk IV light bombers during Operation Crusader. Heavy rainstorms in November-December 1941 severely impacted operations, waterlogging forward airfields. Squadron conducted engine overhauls at Gambut under difficult field conditions. Commander for Q4 1941 not definitively identified in available Tier 2 sources. Squadron previously commanded by Acting Sqn Ldr Patrick Troughton-Smith (earlier in 1941) but he was posted to Belfast by October 1941. Squadron part of Western Desert Air Force created 21 October 1941.
metadata.witw_validation: Unit confirmed in RAF Middle East Command structure. WITW aircraft ID 609 for Blenheim IV verified in WITW _aircraft.csv database.
